Message of Sympathy to U.K. Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to U.K. Prime Minister 
    Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of sympathy to Tony Blair, prime minister of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
 The message expressed deep sympathy with and consolation to the prime minister and, through him, to the U.K. government and all victims in connection with the casualties of many innocent people caused by a series of explosions in London on July 7.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his U.K. counterpart Jack Straw.

Exercise of Jurisdiction on Criminals of U.S. Forces Demanded
articles.content:
Exercise of Jurisdiction on Criminals of U.S. Forces Demanded 
    Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The "emergency measure committee for probing truth behind the killing of the south Korean woman by U.S. army truck" in south Korea reportedly demanded the exercise of jurisdiction on the criminals of the U.S. forces.
 The organization at a press conference held on July 4 in front of the government building denounced the results of the police investigation into the killing of woman Kim Myong Ja by a U.S. army truck in Tongduchon City, Kyonggi Province, on June 10. It strongly demanded the government authorities exercise jurisdiction on the criminals for probing the truth behind the case.    
 If the U.S. forces are allowed to exercise jurisdiction on the case, the truth behind the case will be hidden and the criminals will be declared not guilty as was the case with the murder of two schoolgirls in 2002, the organization charged.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Zhang Weihua's Family
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Zhang Weihua's Family 
    Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was sent by the family of Zhang Weihua, anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, Thursday to be placed before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of his demise.
 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were words "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Live Forever".

Korean Film "Fatherly Leader with Officials" Screened
articles.content:
Korean Film "Fatherly Leader with Officials" Screened
    Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The Korean documentary film "Fatherly Leader with Officials" was screened at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
 The film deals with historical facts about how earnestly Kim Il Sung led officials, finding himself among officials, from the early period of building a new country to the last moments of his life.
 The film impressively tells stories that the President trained officials as commanding members of the revolution, invited them to accompany him during his field guidance and called them to the meetings where he gave valuable instructions and led them with profound loving care so that they might become true revolutionaries who faithfully uphold the idea and leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 Among the audience were senior officials of the Party and the state, chairpersons of the friendly parties, Cabinet members and officials of the working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions.
